image.altText: Pete Hegseth with his face screwed up and hand raised as he berated the press

props.synopsis: The US defense secretary claimed reporters' "hatred" of Donald Trump was behind efforts to verify the extent of the damage to the Fordow nuclear facility in Iran.

title.children: Hegseth fumes at press as Pentagon releases more mission details

image.altText: An emaciated child lies on a bed and looks on.

props.synopsis: Palestinian health authorities say more than 800 Gazans were killed in IDF attacks during Israel's 12-day war with Iran, as a starvation crisis grips the besieged territory.

title.children: As world watched Israel-Iran war, in Gaza hundreds were killed

image.altText: a young woman walks pasta flag of the Islamic Republic of Iran

props.synopsis: More than 46 years after the 1979 Iranian Revolution, there is talk among Iranians — both those living in Iran and among the diaspora — that the end of the Islamic Republic of Iran is nearing. But without defections, a united opposition, and mass civil uprising, the pathway to freedom is fraught.

title.children: Young Iranians say there's no clear alternative if regime collapses

image.altText: Angus Taylor in a grey suit and blue tie talks to a crowd of obscured people, gesturing with his right hand as if lecturing.

props.synopsis: Moderates and conservatives are split over whether the party should force itself to boost female representation with a formal mechanism, or whether it can be trusted to do so organically.

title.children: Taylor rejects Liberal quotas for women as Ley remains undecided

image.altText: An image of Erin Patterson.

props.synopsis: Justice Christopher Beale is continuing his instructions to the jury in Erin Patterson's murder trial. Ms Patterson is accused of killing three relatives by serving them a beef Wellington containing death cap mushrooms. Follow the proceedings live.

title.children: Jury instructions continue in Erin Patterson's triple-murder trial

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: We return to the dumped dehydrator

image.altText: A black and white close-up of Anna Wintour in a diamond necklace, jacket with her signature bob and dark sunglasses

props.synopsis: As Anna Wintour steps down as editor of US Vogue after almost 40 years in the role, one thing seems clear: her legacy is as astonishing as her rise.

title.children: Anna Wintour redefined fashion. Her legacy is as astonishing as her rise

image.altText: two men in suits and one with an eyepatch walk out of an airplane down stairs

props.synopsis: The geopolitical conditions for the Israel-Iran war have been brewing for decades, and the past 20 months have seen a titanic power shift.

title.children: Israel's approach to Iran has its origins in letter bombs sent to German scientists

image.altText: Indonesian police escorting a criminal

props.synopsis: Police say that two Australians are suspected of arriving on a scooter and opening fire, and another of facilitating the crime.

title.children: Indonesian police reveal more details of fatal shooting of Australian man in Bali

image.altText: Peter Wellman James on a beach.

props.synopsis: Darwin drug baron Peter Wellman James, who's now in prison for supplying drugs, was running a fleet of ATMs despite a prior 2012 conviction.

title.children: Darwin's biggest drug dealer owned network of private ATMs

image.altText: A man's hand writing notes in a notebook in front of ASX boards

props.synopsis: The Australian share market looks set to follow Wall Street higher, while the US government looks set to drop a controversial "revenge tax" on investors. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX to rise as Wall St nears records, US 'revenge tax' dropped

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Scott Bessent asks US Congress to drop 'revenge tax'
ASX poised to rise as Wall Street nears records

image.altText: Josh Inglis shoulders arms and is bowled

props.synopsis: Australia leads the West Indies by 82 runs with six wickets remaining after a controversial day two of the first Test in Barbados.

title.children: More DRS drama as Aussies ride their luck against fired-up Windies

image.altText: An elderly woman standing in front of the beach, crying.

props.synopsis: Even though she owns a cottage at Beauty Point Tourist Park, 82-year-old Kathleen Philp has been given an eviction notice by management, in a move the premier has called "cruel and heartless".

title.children: Woman left homeless after being evicted from cottage she owns

image.altText: Clothes hanging on washing lines strung between palm trees above sand.

props.synopsis: The Pacific Island nation has rushed to apply to live in Australia under a landmark climate change visa.

title.children: In four days, nearly a third of Tuvalu applied to live in Australia

image.altText: Jim Chalmers responds to ABC Leaders Debate, federal election 20

props.synopsis: The treasurer has lowered expectations about achieving specific outcomes at his tax summit but he'll be looking for broad support in one direction.

title.children: Jim Chalmers is aiming for tax reform. Ken Henry has some ideas

image.altText: A sign that says Westmead Health Precinct on the side of a hospital building. Another sign says Westmead Hospital.

props.synopsis: Westmead Hospital is faced with the prospect of having no interventional radiology services from next month unless it can come to an agreement with the specialists, who have collectively resigned.

title.children: Group of radiologists collectively resign from troubled Sydney hospital

image.altText: A woman with a baby magpie

props.synopsis: Sandie Gillard has helped care for animals for most of her life and says a magpie named Jellybean is a big part of the reason she is still alive.

title.children: Hero magpie helps save wildlife carer's life

image.altText: A black bear walks among a green field

props.synopsis: A bear roaming the runway forced a Japanese airport to cancel flights and declare itself off-limits to passengers.

title.children: Roaming bear in runway 'stalemate' at Japanese airport

image.altText: A red brick school building with manicured lawns and gardens.

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken to a dozen families who say their sons have been subjected to, or groomed to inflict, violent punishments in an alleged decades-old cycle of torment at the Victorian boarding school.

title.children: Parents hire lawyers over alleged abuse at prestigious Ballarat Grammar

image.altText: A traditional Indigenous headdress. It is of pyramid shape and has feathers at the top.

props.synopsis: A collection of 37 items gifted to former Mornington Island residents in the 1970s will be taken thousands of kilometres home after decades in the dark.

title.children: Artefacts kept in storage for decades to be returned to ancestral home

image.altText: Gun image

props.synopsis: WA Police Minister Reece Whitby says officials from two states have reached out to discuss its strict new gun law reforms as firearm control groups call for a national approach.

title.children: State governments coy on interest in copying WA's tough new gun laws

image.altText: a sketch of an old man

props.synopsis: Didier Dubreucq has died a month after he was convicted of stealing jewellery worth millions from Kim Kardashian in a 2016 Paris robbery.

title.children: Kim Kardashian 'grandpa robber' dies one month after conviction

image.altText: A distant river bank with a large crocodile on it.

props.synopsis: The croc was spotted in an "atypical" place on Queensland's Fraser Coast and will be removed from the wild.

title.children: Rangers hunt for 2.5m crocodile seen in 'atypical' habitat

image.altText: Min Woo Lee on one of the green at Detroit Golf Club.

props.synopsis: Min Woo Lee is lauding his major-winning sister Minjee after returning to form with a first-round 63 at the PGA Tour event in Detroit.

title.children: Major winner Minjee Lee inspires brother Min Woo at Detroit PGA Tour event

image.altText: Ilotopie performers coated head to toe in pink photorapher from behind, feat their naked bottoms painted pink

props.synopsis: Thirty years after they were thrown into an Adelaide prison for public nudity, legendary French street artists Ilotopie returned to the scene of the crime — as nude, and as proud, as ever.

title.children: These artists came to Australia to wow us. Their show landed them in jail

image.altText: Emergency services were called to a home in Clayfield just after 8pm, where they found the man's body.

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to a home in the suburb just after 8pm, where they found the 58-year-old man's body, as well as a "large group of teenagers", police said.

title.children: Teenage boy charged with murder after man's body found in Clayfield

image.altText: A healthcare worker holds three bottles of HIV antiretroviral tablets.

props.synopsis: Hopes of ending the global HIV epidemic anytime soon are fading among health workers and scientists, who say new infections could increase for the first time in decades.

title.children: 'Existential crisis': Global HIV fight devastated by US funding cuts

image.altText: A woman with brown hair smiles at the camera in an office with books on a shelf in the background.

props.synopsis: For a third consecutive year the Pilbara has the highest proportional movement of GPs out of the region, losing 23.4 per cent of its workforce.

title.children: Local governments at a loss on how to retain GPs in their regions

image.altText: A man with a missing hand, sitting in a wheelchair in his home.

props.synopsis: A spate of fishermen presenting to a small regional Queensland hospital in agony with gaping wounds sparked an investigation into the spread of a deadly infection.

title.children: Study finds climate change is driving spread of flesh-eating bacteria

image.altText: A small dog sits in a pink chair in a room with a fake fireplace and a small, fancy dog bed in the background.

props.synopsis: Luxury pet hotels, wedding chaperones and doggy outings. Here's what Australians are spending on their pets.

title.children: Pets are fuelling a booming industry as owners spend more than ever

image.altText: A hand holding up a phone displaying various uses of AI chatbot ChatGPT against a leafy backdrop

props.synopsis: Whether it's increasing productivity at school and work or creating concerns for people's job security, our readers share the ways generative AI is impacting their lives.

title.children: How generative AI is impacting our readers' everyday lives

image.altText: Faith Kipyegon approaches the finish line in her attempt to break the four-minute mile barrier.

props.synopsis: With the aid of innovative kit, super-spikes and a group of mostly male pacers, Faith Kipyegon runs the fastest mile by a woman in history, although the time will not count as a world record.

title.children: Kipyegon falls short in bid for first sub-four-minute mile

image.altText: Aerial photo of Port Neill Jetty taken by drone on June 26 2025.

props.synopsis: Historic jetties are causing financial headaches for councils as they hand back responsibility for their upkeep to the state government.

title.children: Coastal erosion costs cause uncertain future for beloved SA jetties

image.altText: Selfie of Megan Maurice, with short hair, closed mouth smile and tshirt with line: If you hate Pat Cummings, I hate you.

props.synopsis: A fear of death plagues many of us, and gets in the way of us speaking about it and preparing for it, despite its inevitability. Here's how we could turn that around.

title.children: Megan wanted to talk to her daughter about having cancer. Here's how she did it

image.altText: A banner hanging on a bridge in Venice that says no space for Bezos

props.synopsis: From Donald Trump's shock profanity to Jeff Bezos moving his wedding due to angry protesters, it has been another big week in news. Test yourself on what you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Trump's shock profanity, hungry bears and a billionaire's wedding woes
